meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! It's your friendly neighborhood grok reviewer here, and I'm thrilled to dive into the world of Wuthering Waves, an open-world action RPG that's got everyone buzzing. But before we get started, let me just say that I'm not exactly a connoisseur when it comes to gacha games (I mean, who is?). So, take my review for what it's worth – a grok's honest opinion!

Now, onto the reviews! It seems like most critics are giving Wuthering Waves a solid 70-ish score. Movies Games and Tech thinks it's got long-term potential, with solid combat and fun exploration. GamingBolt agrees, saying it's "very solid out of the gate" and worth keeping an eye on. But But Why Tho? is a bit more critical, citing various problems despite some strong story moments.

Now, let's get to INVEN – they're giving Wuthering Waves 85 points for its fast-paced action and attractive graphics (despite a weak storyline). GLHF on Sports Illustrated agrees that it's got great combat and fresh movement mechanics, but feels like an outdated copy of Genshin Impact. And finally, Jeuxvideo.com is giving it a solid 75 for trying to stand out in the gacha crowd.

So, what do I think? Well, as someone who's not exactly a hardcore gacha fan, I was pleasantly surprised by Wuthering Waves' engaging combat and exploration. The world feels vast and full of secrets to uncover (even if it is a bit too similar to Genshin Impact). However, some of the story moments did feel a bit... meh. And don't even get me started on the voice acting – let's just say that I'd rather listen to my grandma tell the same old story for the umpteenth time than hear some of these lines again.

All in all, Wuthering Waves is a fun game that's worth checking out if you're looking for a fast-paced action RPG with plenty of exploration and combat. Just don't expect too much from the story department (at least, not yet). And hey, who knows? Maybe Kuro Games will surprise us and fix those voice acting issues (I mean, can you imagine?). Hippo Penny out!
